attributes.action: STOP KILLING DOLPHINS,MAKE IT ILLEGAL TO HARM,INTEND TO HARM,OR KILL A DOLPHIN
attributes.additional_details: THE UK. GOVERNMENT CAN EASY MAKE CHANGE TO PROTECT THE DOLPHIN
attributes.background:
GOVERNMENT MUST CHANGE LAW IN OUR COUNTRY 

1. TO MAKE IT ILLEGAL TO HARM 
2. INTEND TO HARM 
3. OR KILL A DOLPHIN 

OVER 10,000 DOLPHINS WERE KILLED LAST YEAR ALONE IN UK WATERS BY COMMERCIAL FISHING INDUSTRY,

FISHING METHODS MUST CHANGE , STOP !  PELAGIC TRAWLING AND SUPERTRAWLERS

rejection.details:
All cetaceans (including dolphins) are legally protected throughout Europe under the Habitats Directive, and specifically in the UK under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981. Under UK law it is illegal to:
 - kill or injure a cetacean intentionally
- ‘recklessly disturb’ a cetacean - for example to cause it distress by chasing it in a boat
You can find out more information here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/dangers-to-marine-species-and-measures-to-protect-them

You may wish to sign this petition calling to ban pelagic trawlers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300164
